questions.question: He is not …………………… intelligent as his brother.
questions.description: Positive adjectives are used in the structure as...as...

questions.question: Mt. Everest is the ………………………… peak in the world.
questions.description: The superlative is used to compare something with the whole group it belongs to.

questions.question: Oranges are …………………….. than apples.
questions.description: Cheaper is the comparative form of cheap. The comparative form is used before than.

questions.question: I don’t earn as …………………….. as you do.
questions.description: Much is used to express uncountable ideas.

questions.question: No other animal is …………………………. large as the blue whale.
questions.description: Either as or so is possible here.

questions.question: The pen is ………………………. than the sword.
questions.description: Mightier is the comparative form of mighty.

questions.question: Africa is ……………………….. than any other continent.
questions.description: Use the comparative form before than.

questions.question: Beethoven is one of the ………………………….. composers of music.
questions.description: The superlative is used to compare one person with the whole group they belong to.

questions.question: Kashmir is …………………………. than any other place in India.
questions.description: More beautiful is the comparative form of beautiful.

questions.question: Ravi is the …………………………. of my sons.
Cancer is ………………………. than any other disease.
questions.description: Deadlier is the comparative form of deadly.

questions.question: You eat a lot ……………………… than I do.
questions.description: More is the comparative form of much and many.
